tactic: induction H as [ | a b H1 H2 IH].
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 0 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x y : Map bool, eqm_bool x y = true -> x = y

Premises:
Inductive Map (A : Type) : Type := M0 : Map A | M1 : ad -> A -> Map A | M2 : Map A -> Map A -> Map A For Map: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M0: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M1: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For M2: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
eqm_bool = fix eqm_bool (x y : Map bool) {struct y} : bool := match x with | @M0 _ => match y with | @M0 _ => true | _ => false end | @M1 _ a b => match y with | @M1 _ c d => (a =? c)%N && eq_bool b d | _ => false end | @M2 _ a b => match y with | @M2 _ c d => eqm_bool a c && eqm_bool b d | _ => false end end : Map bool -> Map bool -> bool
BinInt.Z.leb_gt : forall x y : Z, BinInt.Z.leb x y = false < -> BinInt.Z.lt y x
Zbool.Zle_bool_total : forall x y : Z, {BinInt.Z.leb x y = true} + {BinInt.Z.leb y x = true}
chain_concat_s : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A (single A x) y)
dist_chain_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : prechain A -> Prop), (forall x : Map A, P (single A x)) -> (forall x y : Map A, x <> y -> P (concat A (single A x) y)) -> (forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> P (concat A z x) -> P (concat A (concat A z x) y)) -> forall p : prechain A, dist_chain A p -> P p
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare x y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : Z -> Z -> bool Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
dist_concat_s : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) y)
Inductive dist_chain (A : Set) : prechain A -> Prop := dist_single : forall x : Map A, dist_chain A (single A x) | dist_concat_s : forall x y : Map A, x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) y) | dist_concat_m : forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) y) For dist_chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For dist_concat_m: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _]
dist_concat_m : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) y)
chain_concat_m : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A z x) -> chain A T r (concat A (concat A z x) y)
Inductive chain (A : Set) : mEnsemble A -> mRelation A -> prechain A -> Prop := chain_single : forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> chain A T r (single A x) | chain_concat_s : forall (x y : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> T y -> r x y ->...-> chain A T r (concat A (concat A z x) y) For chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For chain_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _] For chain_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _ _ _] For chain_concat_m: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _]
map_sum : forall (A : Set) (m : Map A), m = M0 A \/ (exists (a : ad) (x : A), m = M1 A a x) \/ (exists x y : Map A, m = M2 A x y)
iteres_last : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat) (y : prechain A) (z : Map A), iteres A f x n = concat A y z -> z = f (prechain_last A y)
prechain_sum : forall (A : Set) (p : prechain A), (exists x : Map A, p = single A x) \/ (exists (x : Map A) (y : prechain A), p = concat A y x)
lazy_power_eg_power_0 : forall (A : Set) (egalite : Map A -> Map A -> bool) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), (forall a b : Map A, egalite a b = true <-> a = b) -> forall z : Map A, (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_true A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n /\ z = f z) /\ (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_false A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n)
MapSweep_semantics_4 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A) (a : ad) (y : A), MapGet A m a = Some y -> f a y = true -> {a' : ad & {y' : A | MapSweep A f m = Some (a', y')}}
lazy_power_eg_power : forall (A : Set) (egalite : Map A -> Map A -> bool) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), (forall a b : Map A, egalite a b = true <-> a = b) -> lazy_power A egalite f x n = power (Map A) f x n
MapSweep_semantics_4_1 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A) (pf : ad -> ad) (a : ad) (y : A), MapGet A m a = Some y -> f (pf a) y = true -> {a' : ad & {y' : A | MapSweep1 A f pf m = Some (a', y')}}
MapSweep_semantics_3 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A), MapSweep A f m = None -> forall (a : ad) (y : A), MapGet A m a = Some y -> f a y = false
MapSweep_semantics_1 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A) (a : ad) (y : A), MapSweep A f m = Some (a, y) -> f a y = true
N.eqb_refl : forall x : N, (x =? x)%N = true
MapFlag_sum : forall (A : Set) (f : MapFlag A), exists x : Map A, f = flag_true A x \/ f = flag_false A x
iteres_ult_const_4 : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), non_dist_chain A (iteres A f x n) -> exists p : nat, S p <= n /\ power (Map A) f x p = power (Map A) f x (S p)
iteres_eq_0 : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), prechain_last A (iteres A f x n) = power (Map A) f x n
iteres_non_sas_chain_fp_0 : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n m : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> increasing_app A r f -> r x (f x) -> bounded_sas_chain A T r m -> m <= n -> exists p : nat, S p <= n /\ power (Map A) f x p = power (Map A) f x (S p)
iteres_non_sas_chain : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n m : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> increasing_app A r f -> r x (f x) -> bounded_sas_chain A T r m -> m <= n -> chain A T r (iteres A f x n) /\ ~ dist_chain A (iteres A f x n)
eq_true_negb_classical : forall b : bool, negb b <> true -> b = true
MapPut_behind_as_Merge_c : forall (A : Type) (m : Map A), mapcanon A m -> forall (a : ad) (y : A), MapPut_behind A m a y = MapMerge A (M1 A a y) m
MapPut_as_Merge_c : forall (A : Type) (m : Map A), mapcanon A m -> forall (a : ad) (y : A), MapPut A m a y = MapMerge A m (M1 A a y)

```coq
intros x y H.
induction H as [ | a b H1 H2 IH].
- simpl. reflexivity.
- destruct x as [ | ad1 a1 | x1 x2 ]; destruct y as [ | ad2 a2 | y1 y2 ]; try discriminate.
  + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto.
  + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto.
  + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto.
Qed.```

original: intros x y H. induction H as [ | a b H1 H2 IH]. - simpl. reflexivity. - destruct x as [ | ad1 a1 | x1 x2 ]; destruct y as [ | ad2 a2 | y1 y2 ]; try discriminate. + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto. + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto. + rewrite <- IH. simpl. rewrite H1. rewrite H2. auto.
